excerpt: Hilltop, Hindu temple complex with distinctive domed roofs, originally dating from the 7th century.
detail_description: Perched atop Nilachal hill in Guwahati, Assam, India, the Maa Kamakhya Temple is an ancient Hindu pilgrimage site dating back to the 7th century. It is dedicated to Goddess Kamakhya and is considered one of the most sacred places of pilgrimage in India. The temple is part of the 51 Shakti Peethas and holds great significance for both Hindus and Tantric worshipers.
name: Maa Kamakhya Temple
address: Kamakhya, Guwahati, Assam 781010, India

excerpt: Museum with a unique array of historical pieces from the area, such as sculptures, coins & books.
detail_description: The Assam State Museum in Guwahati houses a diverse collection of historical artifacts including sculptures, coins, and books that offer insight into the local heritage. It is a must-visit attraction for those interested in exploring the rich cultural history of Assam.
name: Assam State Museum
address: GNB Rd, near Dighalipukhuri, Mawhati, Ambari, Guwahati, Assam 781001, India

excerpt: Modest astronomical museum in a unique building with planetarium shows multiple times a day.
detail_description: The Guwahati Planetarium, situated in the lively city of Guwahati, Assam, is a unique astronomical museum housed in a distinctive building with red sloping walls and a large white dome. Since its establishment in 1994, the planetarium has been dedicated to educating the public about celestial phenomena and the marvels of the universe through captivating shows and exhibitions.
name: Guwahati Planetarium
address: 5QR2+HQ8, MG Rd, Latasil, Uzan Bazar, Guwahati, Assam 781001, India

excerpt: Scenic, landscaped park featuring many flower gardens & sculptures, plus play areas for children.
detail_description: Nehru Park, situated in the heart of Guwahati and named after India's first prime minister, Pt. Jawaharlal Nehru, is one of the city's oldest parks. The park boasts meticulously maintained flower gardens, play areas for children, a jogging track, a rock garden, and an amphitheater. One of its main attractions is the 45 beautifully crafted statues depicting various dance forms of Assam.
name: Nehru Park
address: Cotton University Rd, Pan Bazaar, Guwahati, Assam 781001, India

excerpt: Rebuilt after an earthquake in 1897, this revered Shiva temple attracts visitors by boat & ferry.
detail_description: Umananda Temple, situated on Peacock Island in the Brahmaputra River, is a revered Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Built in 1694 AD, it holds great historical significance and is considered one of the most important temples in Assam. Accessible by boat, this serene location attracts visitors from far and wide. The temple hosts the famous Shiva Chaturdasi festival annually, drawing a large number of devotees.
name: Umananda Temple
address: Umananda Island, Baruah Souk, North Guwahati, Guwahati, Assam 781030, India

excerpt: Ancient temple on a hill originally built to study Hindu astronomy's 9 major celestial bodies.
detail_description: Nestled atop Chitrasal Hill in Guwahati, Assam, the Navagraha Temple stands as a revered pilgrimage destination dedicated to the nine celestial bodies of Hindu astrology. This ancient temple not only serves as a spiritual haven for devotees seeking astrological balance but also offers breathtaking views of the surrounding cityscape.
name: Navagraha Temple
address: chandmari, ghy-781003, Guwahati, Assam 781003, India

excerpt: Huge, long-running zoo with a vast array of exotic animals, plus a botanical garden & eateries.
detail_description: Assam State Zoo cum Botanical Garden, located in Guwahati, India, is a renowned destination for wildlife enthusiasts and families. Established in 1957, this expansive sanctuary houses a diverse range of exotic animals and serves as a crucial conservation site for endangered species such as the Indian rhinoceros and white tiger. Visitors can also explore the botanical garden's extensive collection of indigenous and exotic plants that enhance the lush landscape.
name: Assam State Zoo cum Botanical Garden
address: RG Baruah Rd, Guwahati, Assam 781005, India

excerpt: Protected freshwater lake wetland site for sea & shore birds, reptiles, amphibians & insects.
detail_description: Dipor Bil, also known as Deepor Beel, is a significant freshwater wetland located near Guwahati in Assam, India. This picturesque area is home to a diverse range of flora and fauna, making it a haven for sea and shore birds, reptiles, amphibians, and insects. As part of the Brahmaputra River basin, Dipor Bil not only offers stunning scenery but also plays a crucial role in supporting local fishing and agriculture practices.
name: Dipor Bil
address: Guwahati, Assam

excerpt: Fancy Bazaar is a locality in Guwahati, surrounded by localities of Pan Bazaar, Lakhtokia with nearest airport at Borjhar and Railway Station at Paltan Bazaar. It is known as the business hub of Northeast region. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Fancy Bazaar, located in Guwahati, is a bustling commercial hub and one of the oldest markets in the region. It is surrounded by localities such as Pan Bazaar and Lakhtokia, with convenient access to the nearest airport at Borjhar and Railway Station at Paltan Bazaar.
name: Fancy Bazaar
address: Guwahati, Assam, India

excerpt: This large cultural center features a museum, library & open-air theater with mountain views.
detail_description: Srimanta Sankaradeva Kalakshetra, located in Guwahati, Assam, is a cultural institution dedicated to preserving and promoting the rich heritage of the region. It was built in the 1990s as a tribute to Srimanta Sankardeva, a prominent figure in the Neo-Vaishnavism movement. The complex includes a museum, library, and open-air theater with scenic mountain views.
name: Srimanta Sankaradeva Kalakshetra
address: Panjabari Rd, Batahguli, Guwahati, Assam 781037, India

excerpt: Bridge with a highway, rail line & pedestrian pathway, plus sweeping views of the Brahmaputra.
detail_description: Saraighat Bridge, a multi-functional structure, accommodates a highway, railway line, and pedestrian pathway while offering stunning vistas of the Brahmaputra River. As the first of its kind on the river, this railway-to-road bridge has been in operation since 1962 and holds significant importance for the Northeast region of the country.
name: Saraighat Bridge
address: Assam, India

excerpt: Quaint Hindu temple known for its domed roof, picturesque forest setting & cave pilgrimage site.
detail_description: Basistha Temple, situated in the serene surroundings of Beltola, Guwahati, is an ancient Hindu shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva. Believed to have been founded by the legendary sage Vashistha, it is one of the oldest temples in Assam and a popular spiritual retreat. The temple complex exudes tranquility and offers a picturesque forest setting ideal for meditation and worship.
name: Basistha Temple
address: Temple, Basistha, Guwahati, Assam 781029, India

excerpt: Guwahati is a sprawling city beside the Brahmaputra River in the northeast Indian state of Assam. Itâ€™s known for holy sites like the hilltop Kamakhya Temple, featuring shrines to the Hindu deities Shiva and Vishnu. To the east, 18th-century Navagraha Temple is an astronomical center with planetary shrines. Umananda Temple, dedicated to Shiva and covered with engravings, stands on Peacock Island in the river.
detail_description: Guwahati, located on the south bank of the Brahmaputra River, is the largest city in Assam and Northeast India. It serves as a gateway to the region and offers a blend of old and new sights. The city is home to several holy sites such as Kamakhya Temple and Umananda Temple on Peacock Island. Guwahati's back alleys and old quarters provide opportunities to capture timeless pictures and experience local flavor amid its suburban sprawl.
name: Guwahati
address: Assam, India

name: SUNSET STAR CRUISE BRAHMAPUTRA
address: Lachit Ghat, MG Rd, opp. Federal Bank, Machkhowa, Guwahati, Assam 781001, India

excerpt: Sualkuchi is a census town in Kamrup district in the Indian state of Assam. It is situated on the north bank of the river Brahmaputra, about 35 km from Guwahati, Sualkuchi is a block of Kamrup District. Wikipedia.
name: Sualkuchi
address: Assam 781103, India

detail_description: Nestled in the bustling heart of Guwahati, ISKCON Guwahati stands as a vibrant spiritual and cultural landmark dedicated to Lord Krishna. This temple is part of the renowned International Society for Krishna Consciousness, which promotes dynamic spirituality rooted in ancient Hindu texts like the Bhagavad Gita and Srimad Bhagavatam. The architecture here beautifully marries modern design with traditional elements, creating an inviting atmosphere filled with melodious chanting and devotional music.
name: ISKCON Guwahati
address: Kasturba Ashram Rd, South Sarania, Ulubari, Guwahati, Assam 781007, India

detail_description: Guwahati War Memorial, located near Nehru Park and the Ropeway, is a serene and well-maintained site dedicated to honoring the martyrs of Guwahati's historical past. Established by the Rajya Sainik Board, it pays tribute to all those who sacrificed their lives. The memorial features a statue of the renowned warrior Lachit Borphukan and his army, along with modern war equipment on display.
name: War Memorial
address: 5QQ2+RFM, Fatick Chandra Rd, Latasil, Uzan Bazar, Guwahati, Assam 781001, India

excerpt:
Dispur is the capital of the Indian state of Assam and is a suburb of Guwahati.
It became the capital in 1973, when Shillong the erstwhile capital, became the capital of the state of Meghalaya that was carved out of Assam.
Dispur is the seat of power of Government of Assam. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Dispur, the capital of Assam, is a suburb of Guwahati and took over the role from Shillong in 1973. It serves as the seat of power for the Government of Assam. This town offers a blend of tradition, tribal culture, and a pleasant environment. Dispur is known for its tea auctions and ancient Hindu temples like Ganesh Mandir, Durga temple, and Satsang Vihar.
name: Dispur
address: Guwahati, Assam, India

excerpt: Hindu temple known for its South Indianâ€“style architecture, imposing stone idols & parklike grounds.
detail_description: Purva Tirupati Sri Balaji Temple, located in the tranquil outskirts of Guwahati, is a stunning replica of the renowned Tirupati Venkateswara Temple. This Hindu temple showcases traditional South Indian architecture with its gopurams and vibrant sculptures. Dedicated to Lord Venkateswara, it features intricate carvings and a golden dhwaja stambha, creating an enchanting atmosphere for devotion.
name: Purva Tirupati Sri Balaji Temple
address: Betkuchi, P.O, GARCHUK, Guwahati, Assam 781035, India

excerpt: Compact river island with mythological lore, a Hindu temple, tamarind trees & a rare monkey species.
detail_description: Peacock Island, also known as Umananda Island, is a small river island in the Brahmaputra River. It is home to a Hindu temple and tamarind trees, and it's known for its rare monkey species. The island gets its name from the peafowls that inhabit it, adding vibrant colors to the flora and fauna. Visitors can enjoy walking trails and viewpoints offering stunning cityscape views across the water.
name: Peacock Island
address: Baruah Souk, North Guwahati, Guwahati, Assam 781030

detail_description: Dighalipukhuri, located across from the Assam State Museum, is a must-visit destination. Encompassing around 40 acres, this historic pond holds great cultural and historical significance for the city. It has been an integral part of the city's heritage for centuries.
name: Dighalipukhuri
address: Guwahati, Assam, India

excerpt: Amusement & water park providing a variety of rides,  slides & other attractions for all ages.
detail_description: Accoland is a large water amusement park located in Guwahati, offering a wide range of rides and attractions suitable for all ages. It is the first water amusement park in the North-East region and provides a day full of fun and excitement. The park features various thrilling slides and rides, including the adrenaline-pumping 'Tornado' and the relaxing 'Lazy River.'
name: Accoland
address: Guwahati-Accoland-Rani Rd, near BSF Headquarters, Pat Gaon, Garbhanga F.V., Assam 781015, India

excerpt: Science models, an aquarium, a playground & outdoor sculptures, including a full-sized plane.
name: SCIENCE MUSEUM, Khanapara Guwahati
address: 4RC8+5CV, Pir Ajan Fakir Rd, Resham Nagar, Khanapara, Guwahati, Assam 781022, India

detail_description: ALFRESCO GRAND offers a scenic evening river cruise on the Brahmaputra River in Guwahati, providing breathtaking views of the sunset and sunrise. Guests can enjoy live music, cultural activities like folk dance and music, and an island party. The experience includes welcome drinks and snacks, with the option to purchase from a well-stocked bar. The buffet dinner is available at an extra cost. The cruise also features a roof deck for panoramic views of the river banks.
name: ALFRESCO GRAND - BRAHMAPUTRA RIVER CRUISE
address: Jahaj Ghat, Uzan Bazar, Guwahati, Assam 781001, India

excerpt:
Pan Bazaar is a locality in Guwahati, India surrounded by localities of Paltan Bazaar, Ambari and Fancy Bazaar. Situated on the banks of the river Brahmaputra, it is part of the city centre.
Pan Bazaar means "betel-leaf mart" in English. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Pan Bazaar, located in Guwahati, India, is a vibrant locality nestled among other bustling areas like Paltan Bazaar and Ambari. Its name translates to "betel-leaf mart" in English. Positioned along the picturesque banks of the Brahmaputra River, this area forms an integral part of the city center.
name: Pan Bazaar
address: Guwahati, Assam, India

excerpt: Laid-back haunt offering live blues & rock music as well as a menu of Indian & continental dishes.
detail_description: CafÃ© Hendrix, also known as the Jazz Bar, is a popular haunt in Guwahati where live blues and rock music can be enjoyed alongside a menu featuring Indian and continental dishes. Named after the legendary Jimi Hendrix, this iconic spot is a favorite among musicians from northeast India who gather to jam together. The cafÃ© offers high-quality coffee and a limited but delicious food selection, making it an ideal spot for a casual date.
name: CafÃ© Hendrix
address: GS Rd, opp. Pantaloons Down Town, Dispur, Rukmini Gaon, Guwahati, Assam 781022, India

detail_description: Located in Jawahar Nagar, Khanapara, the Smart Bio eToilet at the Regional Science Centre is an engaging destination for visitors of all ages. The center offers interactive exhibits and displays that cover a wide range of scientific topics, aiming to spark curiosity and innovation. One of its highlights is a fossil discovered in the nearby village of Sukhoi Balikuchi, providing insights into the region's prehistoric past.
name: Smart Bio eToilet, Regional Science Centre
address: 4RC8+C34, SCIENCE MUSEUM, Khanapara Guwahati, Resham Nagar, Khanapara, Guwahati, Assam 781028, India

name: Dighalipukhuri Park
address: Dighalipukhuri, Guwahati, Assam 781001, India

detail_description: The Indira Gandhi Athletic Stadium, also known as Sarusajai Stadium, is a versatile sports venue located in Guwahati, Assam. It was opened in 2007 and has since hosted various events including the Assam Global Investors Summit and the South Asian Games. Originally designed with a capacity of 30,000 seats, it underwent modifications for the 2017 FIFA U-17 World Cup which reduced its seating to approximately 28,500.
name: Indira Gandhi Athletic Stadium
address: NH, Nalapara Road, Nalapara, Sarusajai, Guwahati, Assam 781040, India

excerpt: Popular city park with an illuminated fountain, a children's playground, green expanses & gardens.
detail_description: Shraddhanjali Kanan, located in Tarun Nagar, Guwahati, is a popular open-air garden and park opposite the Assam State Zoo. The well-maintained park features vibrant rows of flowers, an illuminated fountain, a children's playground, and green expanses for yoga enthusiasts. Visitors can enjoy various swings and a toy train while taking in performances at the open stage with prior permission.
name: Shraddhanjali Kanan
address: 5Q7H+QXW, RG Baruah Rd, Tarun Nagar, Guwahati, Assam 781006, India

name: Sankardev Kalakshetra Science Museum
address: 4RHC+XV4, Khanapara, Guwahati, Assam 781023, India

name: Gandhi Mandap

detail_description: UZ D 100 Ugratara Mandir is a vibrant red temple located at the picturesque Jorpulkuri Ponds in Guwahati. It is believed to be the place where Sati's navel fell, adding to its spiritual significance. The temple attracts many tourists and is considered a must-visit destination in the area.
name: UZ D 100 UGRATARA MANDIR
address: 5QQ3+P6M, Dighalipukhuri, Guwahati, Assam 781001, India

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant Uzan Bazaar of Guwahati, The Maati Centre is a remarkable initiative led by Pabitra Lama Sarmah and her husband, Rishi Raj Sarmah. This unique project aims to uplift local artisans from charitable organizations like Tihar Jail and Dastkar Ranthambore by showcasing their exceptional craftsmanship.
name: MAATI CENTRE
address: House No 20, Fatick Chandra Rd, Latasil, Uzan Bazar, Guwahati, Assam 781001, India

excerpt:
Ganeshguri is a locality in Guwahati, Assam, and is named after lord Ganesh. There was a Heramba kingdom. Another inscription mentions a ruler named DununtrarÄi, Lord of Hedamba donated a tank in Pragjyotishpura in the year 1577 A.D.
There is also a Ganesh Temple located in its southern part. Wikipedia.
name: Ganeshguri
address: Guwahati, Assam, India

detail_description: Bhubaneswari Temple is a renowned Hindu temple located in Guwahati, Assam. Situated atop a hill near the city center, it offers a stunning panoramic view of Guwahati. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Bhuvaneshwari and is a popular pilgrimage site.
name: Bhubaneswari Temple
address: 5P86+V7Q, Kamakhya, Guwahati, Assam 781010, India

excerpt: Built in 1725, this red & white Hindu temple dedicated to Tara also serves as a Shakti shrine.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Guwahati, Sri Sri Ugratara Devalaya is a stunning red and white Hindu temple that dates back to 1725. Dedicated to Goddess Tara, a form of Goddess Parvati, this Shakti shrine is not only a significant spiritual site but also an architectural gem. Located just 5 km from the city center in the Lotaxil area, it attracts both pilgrims and tourists alike.
name: Sri Sri Ugratara Devalaya
address: Lamb Rd, Uzan Bazar, Guwahati, Assam 781001, India

detail_description: Located in the Silpukhuri area of Guwahati, Assam, the Guwahati War Cemetery is a burial ground situated 2.5 km away from Guwahati Railway Station. It is considered one of the significant historical sites in Assam and is highly recommended for visitors to explore. Initially established during World War II as a final resting place for military hospital patients, it later became a repository for additional graves managed by the Army Graves Service.
name: The Guwahati War Cemetery
address: 5QQ7+6M6, Nabagraha Road Silpukhuri, Silphukuri, Navagraha Hills, Guwahati, Assam 781003, India

name: Jagannath Temple, ISKCON Guwahati
address: 4RF4+G7X, Jayanagar Rd, Jaya Nagar, Beltola Tiniali, Guwahati, Assam 781022, India

excerpt: Paltan Bazaar is a locality of Guwahati, Assam. It is surrounded by the localities of Pan Bazaar, Ulubari, Rehabari, Fancy Bazaar. Its location in the central part of the city-centre is the hub for transportation and hotels in Guwahati, Assam. Wikipedia.
name: Paltan Bazaar
address: Guwahati, Assam, India

detail_description: Deepor Beel Wildlife Sanctuary is a significant riverine wetland in the Brahmaputra Valley, located around 10 km southwest of Guwahati, Assam. It serves as a crucial storm-water storage basin for the city and is home to diverse flora and fauna.
name: Deepor Beel, Wildlife Sanctuary
address: Chakardeo Village, Guwahati, Mikir Para Chakardoi, Assam 781017, India

name: Nepali Mandir

detail_description: Nestled on the scenic Sukreshwar hill, overlooking the majestic Brahmaputra River, Sri Sri Shukleshwar Devalaya is a significant Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Established in 1744 by Ahom King Pramatta Singha and later enhanced by Rajeswar Singha in 1759, this temple holds deep historical roots linked to Saint Sukra, who meditated here. The serene environment makes it an ideal spot for meditation and small religious ceremonies.
name: Sri Sri Sukreshwar Devalaya
address: Shiva Store, near Sukleswar Temple, Pan Bazaar, Guwahati, Assam 781001, India

detail_description: The Brahmaputra River Heritage Centre, located in Guwahati, Assam, is a unique museum celebrating the significance of the Brahmaputra River to the North-East region of India. Housed in a historic bungalow from the British era near the Panbazar ropeway terminal, this museum showcases traditional clothing, sericulture process, musical instruments and depicts Assam's freedom struggle through pictures.
name: Brahmaputra River Heritage Centre
address: 5PQV+H2F, Pan Bazaar, Guwahati, Assam 781001, India
